com.orchestranetworks.ui
Class UIFormSpec

java.lang.Object
  com.orchestranetworks.ui.UIFormSpec
public final class UIFormSpec
extends Object

In the context of UI services, specifies the general features of an HTML form.

Bottom bar

It is possible to set buttons in a bottom bar.

This feature enables a special layout for the workspace: the bottom bar is fixed at the bottom, and the scrollbar on the right is drawn to fit the space between the header and the bottom bar.

Caution: Due to this special layout, no content (HTML code) is allowed before or after the form.

Since:
5.2.0
See Also:
UIServiceComponentWriter.startForm(UIFormSpec)

addActionBackInBottomBar

public void addActionBackInBottomBar(UIButtonSpec actionBack)
Adds a button on the left side of the bottom bar.

Caution: If the form contains a bottom bar, no content (HTML code) is allowed before or after the form.

Parameters:
actionBack - the button's specification.
See Also:
UIButtonSpecSubmit

Caution: If the form contains a bottom bar, no content (HTML code) is allowed before or after the form.

Parameters:
actionBack - the button's specification.
isPreviousStep - true to defines that the button will induce the previous screen/step, false otherwise.

s

setId

public void setId(String id)
Defines the HTML id to the form element.

It is very useful to find the form element with JavaScript. For instance to list form's elements.

The id attribute must respect the W3C Recommendation (in particular be unique in the page). See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/struct/global.html#adef-id for more information.

Parameters:
id - the HTML id of the form.

setJsFnNameToCallBeforeSubmit

public void setJsFnNameToCallBeforeSubmit(String jsFnNameToCallBeforeSubmit)
Sets a JavaScript's function to call before the form's submission.

The DOM form element will be given in argument of this function.

Example:
JavaScript funtion checkFormValidity(formEl) {
  if (formEl.elements["ckbAcceptConditions"].checked) {
    return true; // the form will be sent
  } else {
    alert("Please check the box to accept conditions.");
    return false; // the form will NOT be sent
  }
}
Java myFormSpec.setJsFnNameToCallBeforeSubmit("checkFormValidity");

If the JavaScript's function returns true and if the submit button clicked has a confirmation message, the confirmation message will raise after the call of the JavaScript's function.

Parameters:
jsFnNameToCallBeforeSubmit - the JavaScript's function name to call before the submission of the form.

setMarginForContent

public void setMarginForContent(boolean hasMarginForContent)
Deprecated. since 5.4.0 which provides new look & feel. You can still use UICSSClasses.CONTAINER_WITH_TEXT to have a margin around some text.

Forms are used to display node values (tree layout), or various content (text layout). In the second case, it is advised to set a thin margin for content, otherwise information will be plated on the left border.

Default value is false.

Parameters:
hasMarginForContent - true to enable margin for content, false otherwise.

setMultipart

public void setMultipart(boolean isMultipart)
Defines if the form must be multipart. It is mandatory to enable file uploads.

Default value is false.

Parameters:
isMultipart - true to enable multipart, false otherwise.

setURLForAction

public void setURLForAction(String urlForAction)
Defines the URL of the action attribute of the form.

By default the URL is null, so the form will submit values to its current page.

Parameters:
urlForAction - the URL of the action attribute of the form.

setDetectionOfLostModificationDisabled

public void setDetectionOfLostModificationDisabled(boolean isDisabled)
Sets whether or not a confirmation is asked to the user when the user has entered some input in the form, but the page is left without saving this input.

Default value is false.

Parameters:
isDisabled - true to disable the detection of the form on leaving page, false to enable it and reset to default.
See Also:
UIButtonSpecSubmit.setAskBeforeLeavingModifiedForm(boolean)
